content:
Don't know why you can't see the tag menu with colours. Clicking More in the Message Header, then Tag shows the colours, and the same thing if the Tag button is on the Unified toolbar, and also with Message/Tag from the Menu Bar, and even the message context menu. See the attached pictures.

Does the same thing happen in safe/troubleshoot mode (hold Option when launching TB)?
creator: sfhowes

content:
Compare your settings with these (working) ones:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1417298#answer-1588949

If you prefer POP, the settings are the same except the port is 995.

Change the settings, remove the entries from Saved Passwords in Settings, restart TB, enter the account password in the OAuth window to allow TB access.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Thanks for the advice sfhowes. That seems to have sorted it for now. I can see that this has been a solution for other people and I'm optimistic that you have the fix I needed. I have been in this situation all day and evening though so it's best I monitor it to see whether this has stuck and report back in a day or two.

While being a technical type myself, I am not familiar with this area and the Oauth aspect is at the moment out of my experience. A bit of reading up is required I think. Thanks again for your help. I'll be back.
creator: bordonbert

content: You could also be locked out of your account. Hotmail traditionally ignores any connection attempt in less that 15 minutes after the last. So if you change you connection frequency in account settings to check mail on less than a 15 minute cycle then you will be locked out until the timer for 15 minutes runs down.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hello there

Your apple mac book with m2 processor.

You can use these options to allow your Thunderbird downloads from your Apple product.

go to your device's security options and choose system preferences if possible. Here you go to privacy and security and click on general click on hrt lock and enter your password for changes. here you choose to allow apps to be downloaded.

try this to only allow apps from the app store

(Before attempting to proceed, erase any data or remnants of the installed first installation.Clean the pc after that.Then try to reinstall the newest version attached in this conversation) ) Greetings Firefox volunteer
